subject: Re: [junit] junitx: access levels
msgSnippet: The constructor would be private if is a singleton class i.e only one instance is created and you use a static getInstance() method to get that instance. Also,

The constructor would be private if is a singleton class i.e only one 
instance is created and you use a static getInstance() method to get that 
instance.

Also, you might want it so that only the class is allowed to create it's own 
instances for example if you wanted to create type safe enumerations:

http://www.javacamp.org/designPattern/enum.html

A+ David

On 30/08/05, Ilja Preuss <preuss@...> wrote:
> 
>  Why is the constructor private? How do other clients get an instance?
>
